Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cyto-insectotoxin 1a (CIT 1a; CIT1a; Lys-rich; natural AMPs; spiders, arachnids, Chelicerata, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; ZZI;; UCLL1a;  More AMPs?)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram-positive bacteria A. globiformis, B. subtilis (MIC 0.5-0.9 uM) and Gram-negative bacteria E. coli and P. aeruginosa (MIC 0.5-1.9 uM). The peptide is helical in TFE, SDS, or DOPC LUVs. Recently, it was shown to inhibit C. trachomatis infection at an early stage (Lazarev VN,et al., 2013). Of note is that CIT1a retains its antibacterial activity when expressed as a fusion protein (Ali et al., 2014).
Literature Information.Author: Vassilevski AA, Kozlov SA, Samsonova OV, Egorova NS,  Karpunin DV, Pluzhnikov KA, Feofanov AV and Grishin EV.2008
Literature Information.Title: Cyto-insectotoxins, a novel class of cytolytic and insecticidal peptides from spider venom
